GOD.content: Patoçka: Plato’s novel idea is will to leave womb of Earth Mother, follow path of “pure light,” subordinate (podřídit) orgiastic entirely to responsibility
GOD.linkedContent: Patoçka: Plato’s novel idea is will to leave womb of Earth Mother, follow path of “pure light,” subordinate (podřídit) orgiastic entirely to responsibility

GT.content: perversity can always secretly corrupt the “donner raison à l’autre”: ratio, logos, is on your side [re: “Counterfeit Money”], what counts, can be counted, you took maximum pleasure
GT.linkedContent: perversity can always secretly corrupt the “donner raison à l’autre”: ratio, logos, is on your side [re: “Counterfeit Money”], what counts, can be counted, you took maximum pleasure

GT.content: link btwn morality & calculation of pleasure equivocates good intentions, precipitates gift towards its end, is its very apocalypse [Hamacher], truth of gift > end of gift
GT.linkedContent: link btwn morality & calculation of pleasure equivocates good intentions, precipitates gift towards its end, is its very apocalypse [Hamacher], truth of gift > end of gift

R.content: Aristotle’s Prime Mover, the first desirable, gives a life that exceeds the life of a human, continuous, unending—for us, impossible
R.linkedContent: Aristotle’s Prime Mover, the first desirable, gives a life that exceeds the life of a human, continuous, unending—for us, impossible

R.content: energeia of this pure activity is “pleasure (hēdonē), circle of taking pleasure in oneself (jouissance de soi); a specular auto-affection that accords w/ thinking of thought
R.linkedContent: energeia of this pure activity is “pleasure (hēdonē), circle of taking pleasure in oneself (jouissance de soi); a specular auto-affection that accords w/ thinking of thought

R.content: questions of politics must pass through desire and pleasure
R.linkedContent: questions of politics must pass through desire and pleasure

MONL.content: common language: “Yes, I only have one language, yet it is not mine” > the impossible, inhabiting logical contradiction [suffer & take pleasure in this statement]
MONL.linkedContent: common language: “Yes, I only have one language, yet it is not mine” > the impossible, inhabiting logical contradiction [suffer & take pleasure in this statement]

AF.content: nearly ecstatic instant Freud dreams of [re: Studies on Hysteria]: origin speaking by itself, arkhē appears in the nude, w/out archive, anamnēsis w/out hypomnēsis
AF.linkedContent: nearly ecstatic instant Freud dreams of [re: Studies on Hysteria]: origin speaking by itself, arkhē appears in the nude, w/out archive, anamnēsis w/out hypomnēsis

PP.content: hubris—pharmakon used for excess pleasure & pain, pharmakon hateful because artificial, drugs make illness worse, writing makes memory worse
PP.linkedContent: hubris—pharmakon used for excess pleasure & pain, pharmakon hateful because artificial, drugs make illness worse, writing makes memory worse

FSW.content: difference btwn pleasure/reality principle: original possibility of economy of death, of detour, deferral
FSW.linkedContent: difference btwn pleasure/reality principle: original possibility of economy of death, of detour, deferral

TC.content: [see NIETZSCHE & HEGEL on pure expenditure, death, repetition of affirmation, maintaining presence, consume pure difference w/ pleasure]
TC.linkedContent: [see NIETZSCHE & HEGEL on pure expenditure, death, repetition of affirmation, maintaining presence, consume pure difference w/ pleasure]

F.content: Abraham & Torok: [Wolf Man’s] jouissance jealously preserved (gardée) in his inner safe (for)
F.linkedContent: Abraham & Torok: [Wolf Man’s] jouissance jealously preserved (gardée) in his inner safe (for)

F.content: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings
F.linkedContent: le for du dedans (not intérieur) is not le tribunal de la conscience, even though enclosed w/in forum of self > it is the contradiction w/ in desire [?]: father’s penis neither comes [ne jouisse] nor goes [ni ne périsse] > from this contradiction we understand the solidity of crypt, the indefatigable effort to maintain it, & its failures, permeations from w/in & w/out, its seepings

F.content: topography of crypt follows fracture line from no-place/beyond-place to other place: where “pleasure’s death,” marks the singular pleasure: sauf
F.linkedContent: topography of crypt follows fracture line from no-place/beyond-place to other place: where “pleasure’s death,” marks the singular pleasure: sauf

F.content: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology
F.linkedContent: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology

F.content: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”
F.linkedContent: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”

F.content: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu
F.linkedContent: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu

F.content: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive
F.linkedContent: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive

F.content: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire
F.linkedContent: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire

F.content: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur
F.linkedContent: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur

F.content: “cryptonyms of repressed pleasure words” [re: Grateloup, tieret, rub, scar, Thing]
F.linkedContent: “cryptonyms of repressed pleasure words” [re: Grateloup, tieret, rub, scar, Thing]

FWT.content: deconstruction endures experience of limit of concept, endures this excess, loves, an ecstasy of concept—jouissance—overflowing
FWT.linkedContent: deconstruction endures experience of limit of concept, endures this excess, loves, an ecstasy of concept—jouissance—overflowing

POOF.content: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance
POOF.linkedContent: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance

WM.content: imitation sets man apart from beasts, man alone takes pleasure in imitating > metaphor, an effect of mimēsis and homoiosis, manifestation of analogy, a subordinate means of knowledge: full truth preferred to metaphor
WM.linkedContent: imitation sets man apart from beasts, man alone takes pleasure in imitating > metaphor, an effect of mimēsis and homoiosis, manifestation of analogy, a subordinate means of knowledge: full truth preferred to metaphor

WM.content: to be learning something, recognizing resemblance (the same), is the greatest pleasure, this pleasure is the second [?] “cause” of mimēsis and metaphor
WM.linkedContent: to be learning something, recognizing resemblance (the same), is the greatest pleasure, this pleasure is the second [?] “cause” of mimēsis and metaphor

WM.content: mimeme (neither thing itself, nor tout autre) > elliptical syllogism of mimēsis provides as recompense a dividend of pleasure, “everything like & akin to oneself is pleasant”: finishing work, laughter of resemblance (also, we should not spend all our time imitating monstrous things)
WM.linkedContent: mimeme (neither thing itself, nor tout autre) > elliptical syllogism of mimēsis provides as recompense a dividend of pleasure, “everything like & akin to oneself is pleasant”: finishing work, laughter of resemblance (also, we should not spend all our time imitating monstrous things)

DS.content: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” > hymen
DS.linkedContent: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” > hymen

DS.content: hymen (hymn): supreme spasm, sign of fusion, consummation, marriage, confusion or identification of two > nonpresence, gaping void of desire, & presence, fullness, satisfaction—now amount to same: yet there is not a single term, no fullness of the signified, it’s the difference that no longer functions (btwn empty signifier/full signified, image/thing)
DS.linkedContent: hymen (hymn): supreme spasm, sign of fusion, consummation, marriage, confusion or identification of two > nonpresence, gaping void of desire, & presence, fullness, satisfaction—now amount to same: yet there is not a single term, no fullness of the signified, it’s the difference that no longer functions (btwn empty signifier/full signified, image/thing)

DS.content: no more spatial heterogeneity of 2 poles: l’accomplissement se résume dans le désir, le désir est (en avance sur) l’accomplissement qui demeure, toujours mimé, un désir, “sans briser la glace”
DS.linkedContent: no more spatial heterogeneity of 2 poles: l’accomplissement se résume dans le désir, le désir est (en avance sur) l’accomplissement qui demeure, toujours mimé, un désir, “sans briser la glace”

DS.content: “reflection” so loaded, reduces text to signified theme > thematicism as eudemonistic or hedonistic
DS.linkedContent: “reflection” so loaded, reduces text to signified theme > thematicism as eudemonistic or hedonistic

DS.content: Freud’s inconsistency re: psychoanalysis of work of art: 1) going beyond formal limits toward theme (Stoff) in service of Lustprinzip 2) says, frustrated, the formal artist is given over to Lustprinzip
DS.linkedContent: Freud’s inconsistency re: psychoanalysis of work of art: 1) going beyond formal limits toward theme (Stoff) in service of Lustprinzip 2) says, frustrated, the formal artist is given over to Lustprinzip

POS.content: to “deconstruct” faithful/violent to philosophy, a certain textual work that produces great pleasure, a writing interested in itself that enables us to read philosophemes as symptoms (a word Derrida suspects), the symptom of thinking Being as presence [via Heidegger]
POS.linkedContent: to “deconstruct” faithful/violent to philosophy, a certain textual work that produces great pleasure, a writing interested in itself that enables us to read philosophemes as symptoms (a word Derrida suspects), the symptom of thinking Being as presence [via Heidegger]

P.content: object of 3rd Critique? affect (Gefühl)? pleasure/unpleasure? desire? 1st Critique cuts itself off from interests of desire, excludes desire’s reason, reasons’s desire, desire for reason
P.linkedContent: object of 3rd Critique? affect (Gefühl)? pleasure/unpleasure? desire? 1st Critique cuts itself off from interests of desire, excludes desire’s reason, reasons’s desire, desire for reason

P.content: for Kant, system of pure philosophy (metaphysics) is not yet possible; only critique is possible, produces krinein, in-between > pure philosophy sews everything up, includes critique w/in
P.linkedContent: for Kant, system of pure philosophy (metaphysics) is not yet possible; only critique is possible, produces krinein, in-between > pure philosophy sews everything up, includes critique w/in

P.content: critique detaches, only a moment, related to desire, pleasure/unpleasure, Spur
P.linkedContent: critique detaches, only a moment, related to desire, pleasure/unpleasure, Spur

P.content: “grosse Schwierigkeit” of critical judgment of beauty [un plaisir désintéressé], auto-affection must cathect w/ pure objectivity, universality w/out concept, pure pleasure w/out enjoyment > Wohlgefallen (I-please-myself-in), Je-me-plais-à-me-plaire-à > auto-affection immediately goes outside: is pure hetero-affection, tout autre cathects me, w/out which, there’d be no universality
P.linkedContent: “grosse Schwierigkeit” of critical judgment of beauty [un plaisir désintéressé], auto-affection must cathect w/ pure objectivity, universality w/out concept, pure pleasure w/out enjoyment > Wohlgefallen (I-please-myself-in), Je-me-plais-à-me-plaire-à > auto-affection immediately goes outside: is pure hetero-affection, tout autre cathects me, w/out which, there’d be no universality

P.content: for Kant, no transition to pleasure/displeasure from concepts (save pure practical laws where there is interest, but not attached to judgment of taste)
P.linkedContent: for Kant, no transition to pleasure/displeasure from concepts (save pure practical laws where there is interest, but not attached to judgment of taste)

P.content: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment
P.linkedContent: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment

P.content: acc. Kant, pleasure of knowing (which once existed in a time immemorial [absolute past in a Critique?]), a pleasure of the same—mastery of dissimilar, reduction of heterogenous
P.linkedContent: acc. Kant, pleasure of knowing (which once existed in a time immemorial [absolute past in a Critique?]), a pleasure of the same—mastery of dissimilar, reduction of heterogenous

P.content: “pleasing-oneself-in” of sublime suspends play, elevates to seriousness, nur negativ, relates to moral law, both presuppose violence done to senses, w/ sublime violence done by imagination, not reason > imagination mutilates itself, conceals itself, binds, robs itself: sacrificial violence gains by losing > organizes expropriation w/in calculation > imagination organizes theft of its own freedom, feels sacrifice/theft at same time as the Ursache to which it submits [see GOD]
P.linkedContent: “pleasing-oneself-in” of sublime suspends play, elevates to seriousness, nur negativ, relates to moral law, both presuppose violence done to senses, w/ sublime violence done by imagination, not reason > imagination mutilates itself, conceals itself, binds, robs itself: sacrificial violence gains by losing > organizes expropriation w/in calculation > imagination organizes theft of its own freedom, feels sacrifice/theft at same time as the Ursache to which it submits [see GOD]

OS.content: pleasure one takes in repetition ultimately cannot appear before tribunal of any law > the limit of such a tribunal—philosophy—is in question here
OS.linkedContent: pleasure one takes in repetition ultimately cannot appear before tribunal of any law > the limit of such a tribunal—philosophy—is in question here

ROP.content: Freud’s 5 resistances in “Inhibition, Symptom, Anxiety,” one of which is the ego benefiting from the illness > Derrida finds such behavior so commonplace, he wonders by what confused concept of illness this could be an interesting singularity
ROP.linkedContent: Freud’s 5 resistances in “Inhibition, Symptom, Anxiety,” one of which is the ego benefiting from the illness > Derrida finds such behavior so commonplace, he wonders by what confused concept of illness this could be an interesting singularity

SP.content: question of style, des voiles, laissons l’élytre flotter entre masculin et féminin > our tongue [the French one] assures la jouissance [re: double gender of des voiles]
SP.linkedContent: question of style, des voiles, laissons l’élytre flotter entre masculin et féminin > our tongue [the French one] assures la jouissance [re: double gender of des voiles]

SP.content: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)
SP.linkedContent: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)

ATIA.content: there is a certain jouissance (anguish) when an animal looks at Derrida naked
ATIA.linkedContent: there is a certain jouissance (anguish) when an animal looks at Derrida naked

DIF.content: in Beyond Pleas…, difference btwn pleasure/reality principle is only differance as detour [if “only,” then not differance as relation to impossible presence?]
DIF.linkedContent: in Beyond Pleas…, difference btwn pleasure/reality principle is only differance as detour [if “only,” then not differance as relation to impossible presence?]

O.content: concept > engenderer & consumer (jouissant) of itself, relève its preface, plunges (s’enfonce) into itself > conception of concept an autoinsemination
O.linkedContent: concept > engenderer & consumer (jouissant) of itself, relève its preface, plunges (s’enfonce) into itself > conception of concept an autoinsemination

O.content: return of theological seed to itself, dispersion working for profit of Idea, exclusion as inclusion [not Hegel’s Jew?] > la vérité qui se parle dans le cercle logocentrique, c’est le discours de ce qui revient au père
O.linkedContent: return of theological seed to itself, dispersion working for profit of Idea, exclusion as inclusion [not Hegel’s Jew?] > la vérité qui se parle dans le cercle logocentrique, c’est le discours de ce qui revient au père

O.content: is pleasure literary in essence? if Vorlust, foreplay, prime (bonus) of seduction, formal moment of literature, ne se comble qu’à la fin du plaisir, then jouissance would be instance of seduction, prime supplémentaire de rien d’autre: pleasure a formal, threshold phenomena, nul et sans fins, a repression lifted & maintained > graphics of hymen questions all couples, all oppositions (especially those of Freud)
O.linkedContent: is pleasure literary in essence? if Vorlust, foreplay, prime (bonus) of seduction, formal moment of literature, ne se comble qu’à la fin du plaisir, then jouissance would be instance of seduction, prime supplémentaire de rien d’autre: pleasure a formal, threshold phenomena, nul et sans fins, a repression lifted & maintained > graphics of hymen questions all couples, all oppositions (especially those of Freud)

O.content: le plaisir serait toujours formel et de limen
O.linkedContent: le plaisir serait toujours formel et de limen

O.content: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction
O.linkedContent: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction

DPi.content: DP seduces, vanity beyond death, those fascinated by it can take maximum pleasure from (jouir de) it
DPi.linkedContent: DP seduces, vanity beyond death, those fascinated by it can take maximum pleasure from (jouir de) it

DPi.content: for Nietzsche, jouissance of causing pain, le jouir > right to cruelty
DPi.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, jouissance of causing pain, le jouir > right to cruelty

DPi.content: mechanism of cruelty: take (infinite) pleasure in doing evil for evil’s sake > “genealogy of morals”: theater of cruelty, history of cruelty, prehistory of history as cruelty
DPi.linkedContent: mechanism of cruelty: take (infinite) pleasure in doing evil for evil’s sake > “genealogy of morals”: theater of cruelty, history of cruelty, prehistory of history as cruelty

DPi.content: for Nietzsche, Christianity hyperbolically augments infinite disproportion, pleasure of “highest degree” that accompanies the law of cruelty: finite debt exceeds correspondence by responding w/ a pleasure of cruelty that becomes infinite
DPi.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, Christianity hyperbolically augments infinite disproportion, pleasure of “highest degree” that accompanies the law of cruelty: finite debt exceeds correspondence by responding w/ a pleasure of cruelty that becomes infinite

DPi.content: eudaimon of Heidegger, not only pleasure, not hedonist enjoyment > but Heidegger does not mention how daimon stops talking to Socrates at moment of condemnation to death
DPi.linkedContent: eudaimon of Heidegger, not only pleasure, not hedonist enjoyment > but Heidegger does not mention how daimon stops talking to Socrates at moment of condemnation to death

RGE.content: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse
RGE.linkedContent: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse

REST.content: identification, like attribution, has supplementary/parergonal structure > because demand for reattachment is insatiable, unsatisfied, always making a higher bid, always starts out again
REST.linkedContent: identification, like attribution, has supplementary/parergonal structure > because demand for reattachment is insatiable, unsatisfied, always making a higher bid, always starts out again

HLP.content: paradigm of lie has an essential link to experience of sexual pleasure
HLP.linkedContent: paradigm of lie has an essential link to experience of sexual pleasure

TR.content: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence
TR.linkedContent: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence

TR.content: police, prosecutors, torturers know jubilatory pleasure of handling confession machines
TR.linkedContent: police, prosecutors, torturers know jubilatory pleasure of handling confession machines

TR.content: re: mosquito caught mid-bite in amber coffin or 2 midges making love, a jouissance took place whose archive we preserve, archive of a singular event 54 million years ago > archive of man’s confessions a few centuries ago, fractions of second in history of life, earth, & the rest
TR.linkedContent: re: mosquito caught mid-bite in amber coffin or 2 midges making love, a jouissance took place whose archive we preserve, archive of a singular event 54 million years ago > archive of man’s confessions a few centuries ago, fractions of second in history of life, earth, & the rest

EJQB.content: if writing isn’t a tearing of self toward other w/in a confession of infinite separation, if it takes pleasure for its own sake, it destroys itself—in plenitude, Identity, roundness of egg [cf. p. 66 Jabès renouncing verve, capriciousness]
EJQB.linkedContent: if writing isn’t a tearing of self toward other w/in a confession of infinite separation, if it takes pleasure for its own sake, it destroys itself—in plenitude, Identity, roundness of egg [cf. p. 66 Jabès renouncing verve, capriciousness]

PSSS.content: death drive, origin of all cruelty—from sadism to primary masochism > this death drive sends reality/pleasure principles into crisis
PSSS.linkedContent: death drive, origin of all cruelty—from sadism to primary masochism > this death drive sends reality/pleasure principles into crisis

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis only possible approach, w/out alibi, to all virtual translations btwn the cruelties of a suffering “for the pleasure of it” [?] [I you we cruel-suffer]
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis only possible approach, w/out alibi, to all virtual translations btwn the cruelties of a suffering “for the pleasure of it” [?] [I you we cruel-suffer]

C.content: Derrida will have to change formulas constantly, abandon them like waste products, leftovers of supper interrupted in full enjoyment by an entombment, after declarations which have nothing in common with the thing itself: this is my body, this my name
C.linkedContent: Derrida will have to change formulas constantly, abandon them like waste products, leftovers of supper interrupted in full enjoyment by an entombment, after declarations which have nothing in common with the thing itself: this is my body, this my name

C.content: analogy belongs to order of contingent > appeals neither to model nor example (i.e. both Sade & Titus-Carmel ration the remainder, stage a work & jouissance re: remainder [excrement]) [Derrida is “randomly” comparing Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins to Sade’s 120 days]
C.linkedContent: analogy belongs to order of contingent > appeals neither to model nor example (i.e. both Sade & Titus-Carmel ration the remainder, stage a work & jouissance re: remainder [excrement]) [Derrida is “randomly” comparing Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins to Sade’s 120 days]

C.content: arithmetic compulsion and la narration comptable in Sade’s 120 Days, part of the fun > its regular cadence, rhythmic operation: to excrete excrement, swallow it, en escompter la jouissance ——introjection of mors, morceau [Lacan’s objet a?] always lets drop a heterogenous remainder of incorporation > infinite analysis of mourning btwn introj./incorp.
C.linkedContent: arithmetic compulsion and la narration comptable in Sade’s 120 Days, part of the fun > its regular cadence, rhythmic operation: to excrete excrement, swallow it, en escompter la jouissance ——introjection of mors, morceau [Lacan’s objet a?] always lets drop a heterogenous remainder of incorporation > infinite analysis of mourning btwn introj./incorp.

C.content: rocket of a female orgasm (la fusée d’une jouissance féminine) [?]
C.linkedContent: rocket of a female orgasm (la fusée d’une jouissance féminine) [?]

LI.content: submission to classical normativity/hierarchy in the name seriousness cannot be taken seriously
LI.linkedContent: submission to classical normativity/hierarchy in the name seriousness cannot be taken seriously

LI.content: why not say it was all a parasitic joke (transform infelicity into jouissance)—maybe we will!
LI.linkedContent: why not say it was all a parasitic joke (transform infelicity into jouissance)—maybe we will!

TN.content: acc. Nancy, laughter as philosopher’s presence to himself, contact successfully interrupted gives pleasure of syncope, pleasure of which it is depriving itself
TN.linkedContent: acc. Nancy, laughter as philosopher’s presence to himself, contact successfully interrupted gives pleasure of syncope, pleasure of which it is depriving itself

TN.content: caress, to take or give pleasure?; the order/command “Tiens!” [TN. there, here, hold on to this, take it] is not the same order as tact (the trembling, relinquishment [dessaisissement] at heart of seizing [saisie]) [beyond Lacan’s: “never give up on your desire”?]
TN.linkedContent: caress, to take or give pleasure?; the order/command “Tiens!” [TN. there, here, hold on to this, take it] is not the same order as tact (the trembling, relinquishment [dessaisissement] at heart of seizing [saisie]) [beyond Lacan’s: “never give up on your desire”?]

TN.content: for Levinas, the peace that is ethical found more in the tender caress that renounces possession than in erotic violence acharnée à jouir
TN.linkedContent: for Levinas, the peace that is ethical found more in the tender caress that renounces possession than in erotic violence acharnée à jouir

TN.content: phone sex: phantasm of ecstatic pleasure promises pleasure (through phainesthai)
TN.linkedContent: phone sex: phantasm of ecstatic pleasure promises pleasure (through phainesthai)

TN.content: connection btwn “self-touching” of “human body” [flesh] and body of Christian ontotheology, its eucharistic ecstasy par excellence [Nancy too?]
TN.linkedContent: connection btwn “self-touching” of “human body” [flesh] and body of Christian ontotheology, its eucharistic ecstasy par excellence [Nancy too?]

TN.content: anesthetic interruption in heart of aesthetic phenomenality, anesthetics very ecstasy at heart of pleasure, pleasure as differance w/out delay > plier, prier and invent substitutes, prostheses, fetishes, cultures, technics (all of “history,” before and beyond “hand of man”)
TN.linkedContent: anesthetic interruption in heart of aesthetic phenomenality, anesthetics very ecstasy at heart of pleasure, pleasure as differance w/out delay > plier, prier and invent substitutes, prostheses, fetishes, cultures, technics (all of “history,” before and beyond “hand of man”)

TN.content: this other heart that self touches you, gives pleasure where pleasure’s made more intense by not returning to me, diastole w/out systole > the ecstatic & haptical sans of “sans revenir à soi”
TN.linkedContent: this other heart that self touches you, gives pleasure where pleasure’s made more intense by not returning to me, diastole w/out systole > the ecstatic & haptical sans of “sans revenir à soi”

TN.content: you beat the heart, you interrupt circulation
TN.linkedContent: you beat the heart, you interrupt circulation

TN.content: [re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure
TN.linkedContent: [re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure

TN.content: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself
TN.linkedContent: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself

TN.content: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)
TN.linkedContent: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)

TN.content: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium
TN.linkedContent: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium

E.content: for Kant, science is not art, has no beauty in it, because no pleasure can be taken in it
E.linkedContent: for Kant, science is not art, has no beauty in it, because no pleasure can be taken in it

E.content: yet, in his Introduction, he claims that in an immemorial past, pleasure could not be separated from knowledge, so the Witz (bon mot), the only scientific pleasure, carries this repressed past in it
E.linkedContent: yet, in his Introduction, he claims that in an immemorial past, pleasure could not be separated from knowledge, so the Witz (bon mot), the only scientific pleasure, carries this repressed past in it

E.content: Kant distinguishes agreeable arts from Fine-Arts, the former aims at enjoyment (jouissance, Genuss), the latter dispenses w/ concept (ohne Zweck) and enjoyment, but seeks pleasure (Lust)
E.linkedContent: Kant distinguishes agreeable arts from Fine-Arts, the former aims at enjoyment (jouissance, Genuss), the latter dispenses w/ concept (ohne Zweck) and enjoyment, but seeks pleasure (Lust)

E.content: for Aristotle, imitation is unique to man, belongs to essential definition of man, man takes pleasure in it, it is from it he learns his first knowledge
E.linkedContent: for Aristotle, imitation is unique to man, belongs to essential definition of man, man takes pleasure in it, it is from it he learns his first knowledge

E.content: Kant: sublime occurs due to a momentary checking (Hemmung, an arrest), and its pleasure (admiration or respect) is a negative pleasure
E.linkedContent: Kant: sublime occurs due to a momentary checking (Hemmung, an arrest), and its pleasure (admiration or respect) is a negative pleasure

E.content: vomit gives too much enjoyment, suspends the suspension of non-consummation (which accompanies pleasure bound up w/ representation): it burns up all work as mourning work
E.linkedContent: vomit gives too much enjoyment, suspends the suspension of non-consummation (which accompanies pleasure bound up w/ representation): it burns up all work as mourning work

OG.content: alētheia, privileged instance of a vision filled & satisfied by presence
OG.linkedContent: alētheia, privileged instance of a vision filled & satisfied by presence

OG.content: differance, breathing space, finitude, death makes presence/absence possible: makes possible very thing it makes impossible, produces what it forbids: non-satisfaction (inassouvissement)
OG.linkedContent: differance, breathing space, finitude, death makes presence/absence possible: makes possible very thing it makes impossible, produces what it forbids: non-satisfaction (inassouvissement)

OG.content: [Rousseau] masturbation pleasure irremediable loss of vital substance > exposure to madness & death
OG.linkedContent: [Rousseau] masturbation pleasure irremediable loss of vital substance > exposure to madness & death

OG.content: for Rousseau, danger of image, imaginary seduction, in writing & masturbation, “fatal advantage (funeste avantage)” > the supplement that “trompe (cheats) la nature”
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, danger of image, imaginary seduction, in writing & masturbation, “fatal advantage (funeste avantage)” > the supplement that “trompe (cheats) la nature”

OG.content: dangerous supplement inconceivable to reason: no longer diverting total enjoyment toward a substitute, but experiencing it or miming it directly and in its totality [not kissing the bed to get close to Mamma, but conjuring the presence of Mamma]
OG.linkedContent: dangerous supplement inconceivable to reason: no longer diverting total enjoyment toward a substitute, but experiencing it or miming it directly and in its totality [not kissing the bed to get close to Mamma, but conjuring the presence of Mamma]

OG.content: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]
OG.linkedContent: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]

OG.content: Rousseau’s pernicious habit of donner la change [satisfying his wants, sidetracking, giving money]
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s pernicious habit of donner la change [satisfying his wants, sidetracking, giving money]

OG.content: supplement is maddening, it breaches/broaches (entame) our pleasure and our virginity [hymen]
OG.linkedContent: supplement is maddening, it breaches/broaches (entame) our pleasure and our virginity [hymen]

OG.content: for Rousseau, as dangerous as the supplement is, cohabitation w/ women is even more dangerous, “jouir!” another name for death
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, as dangerous as the supplement is, cohabitation w/ women is even more dangerous, “jouir!” another name for death

OG.content: Rousseau: no intermediary btwn everything & nothing, must substitute
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: no intermediary btwn everything & nothing, must substitute

OG.content: w/ 2 supplements (writing, onanism), auto-affection manifests by leaving a trace of itself in the world, exteriority of space, touchant-touché admits the world as 3rd party, here jouissance and se-donner-une-présence welcome the other in small difference separating l’agir du pâtir (doing from suffering)
OG.linkedContent: w/ 2 supplements (writing, onanism), auto-affection manifests by leaving a trace of itself in the world, exteriority of space, touchant-touché admits the world as 3rd party, here jouissance and se-donner-une-présence welcome the other in small difference separating l’agir du pâtir (doing from suffering)

OG.content: Rousseau: nearer we are to jouissance, further from bonheur ——imagination is differance of or w/in presence or jouissance
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: nearer we are to jouissance, further from bonheur ——imagination is differance of or w/in presence or jouissance

OG.content: for Rousseau, the wand (la baguette) that traces w/ so much pleasure does not fall outside the body (ne tombe pas hors du corps)
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, the wand (la baguette) that traces w/ so much pleasure does not fall outside the body (ne tombe pas hors du corps)

OG.content: [Artaud-like fantasy in Rousseau?] breath (of God), neume, superhumanity, not on the way to humanity (like child), body w/out organs, w/out spacing, pure presence w/ jouissance, inarticulate enough for jouissance de soi to remain uncorrupted by alterity
OG.linkedContent: [Artaud-like fantasy in Rousseau?] breath (of God), neume, superhumanity, not on the way to humanity (like child), body w/out organs, w/out spacing, pure presence w/ jouissance, inarticulate enough for jouissance de soi to remain uncorrupted by alterity

OG.content: jouissance—pure presence to self-auto-affection accorded to God; interior, homogenous, no relation w/ object, welcomes no mortal difference
OG.linkedContent: jouissance—pure presence to self-auto-affection accorded to God; interior, homogenous, no relation w/ object, welcomes no mortal difference

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] no opposition applied to passage btwn state of nature & state of society, to becoming-present of presence (a lasting passage like the present in Reveries): a supplementarity, festival (fête), w/out jeu; moment of festival: pure continuity > society formed morrow of festival (indifference of pleasure & desire): de la danse à la loi
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] no opposition applied to passage btwn state of nature & state of society, to becoming-present of presence (a lasting passage like the present in Reveries): a supplementarity, festival (fête), w/out jeu; moment of festival: pure continuity > society formed morrow of festival (indifference of pleasure & desire): de la danse à la loi

OG.content: local difference: differance btwn desire & pleasure
OG.linkedContent: local difference: differance btwn desire & pleasure

OG.content: for Rousseau, present is always the presence of a jouissance, jouissance always the welcoming of presence > language (anxious research of learning): the spacing btwn 2 jouissances
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, present is always the presence of a jouissance, jouissance always the welcoming of presence > language (anxious research of learning): the spacing btwn 2 jouissances

OG.content: for Rousseau, perversity of sacralizing the representer/signifier
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, perversity of sacralizing the representer/signifier

OG.content: sovereignty as presence/jouissance of present > liberty when signifier suspended & power rendered to the represented/signified; sovereignty not the same as drawing up laws
OG.linkedContent: sovereignty as presence/jouissance of present > liberty when signifier suspended & power rendered to the represented/signified; sovereignty not the same as drawing up laws

OG.content: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude
OG.linkedContent: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude

OG.content: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture
OG.linkedContent: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture

OG.content: unless there’s an extrinsic desire, Leibniz’s universal characteristic represents death of jouissance, scientific machine, pure state of representer > the telos of scriptural alienation
OG.linkedContent: unless there’s an extrinsic desire, Leibniz’s universal characteristic represents death of jouissance, scientific machine, pure state of representer > the telos of scriptural alienation

EU.content: so young & so old, one and the same thing, anachrony in oneself, confusion of identity > this confusion has suddenly gotten much worse—leaving me speechless
EU.linkedContent: so young & so old, one and the same thing, anachrony in oneself, confusion of identity > this confusion has suddenly gotten much worse—leaving me speechless

EU.content: écart alternatif entre la jouissance et la fécondité
EU.linkedContent: écart alternatif entre la jouissance et la fécondité

SPEC.content: in German, Lust (pleasure) also designates jouissance and desire
SPEC.linkedContent: in German, Lust (pleasure) also designates jouissance and desire

SPEC.content: irresolution of scene of writing—a Bindung, tends itself (se tend), ceaseless posting, no final orgasm, beyond of pleasure remaining the end of pleasure > pleasure at its proper moment? still don’t know what it is: secousses orgasmiques, joussiance, deferred as soon as obtained
SPEC.linkedContent: irresolution of scene of writing—a Bindung, tends itself (se tend), ceaseless posting, no final orgasm, beyond of pleasure remaining the end of pleasure > pleasure at its proper moment? still don’t know what it is: secousses orgasmiques, joussiance, deferred as soon as obtained

SPEC.content: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself
SPEC.linkedContent: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself

SPEC.content: pleasure—ungraspable limit btwn 2 limits, un en-deçà et un au-delà qui réduisent un pas à rien ——producing itself, regenerating: only pleasure, pleasure as counter-pleasure, band contra band, tout se passe alors dans des différences de bandage—not general economy (absolute expenditure) but strictural economy (to the point of its inevitable collapse)
SPEC.linkedContent: pleasure—ungraspable limit btwn 2 limits, un en-deçà et un au-delà qui réduisent un pas à rien ——producing itself, regenerating: only pleasure, pleasure as counter-pleasure, band contra band, tout se passe alors dans des différences de bandage—not general economy (absolute expenditure) but strictural economy (to the point of its inevitable collapse)

SPEC.content: PP (the master) is not master > pleasure, the great speculator, calculates w/ effects of aphrodisiac stricture (Socrates wanted nothing to do with proper name of Aphrodite)
SPEC.linkedContent: PP (the master) is not master > pleasure, the great speculator, calculates w/ effects of aphrodisiac stricture (Socrates wanted nothing to do with proper name of Aphrodite)
